snippet: A smoglike haze that hung over part of Kodiak Island recently was courtesy of a volcanic eruption — 100 years ago.
abstract: National Weather Service says smoglike haze over Kodiak Island, Alaska, was caused by strong winds and lack of snow that helped stir up ash from 1912 volcanic eruption.
lead_paragraph: A smoglike haze that hung over part of Kodiak Island recently was courtesy of a volcanic eruption — 100 years ago.
